title:"Magnum Opus Ex" by stardust4ever

desc:All credit for this image goes to "stardust4ever" from the fractalforums.com board, for discovering this amazing Mandelbrot set location.  <a target="_blank" href="http://stardust4ever.deviantart.com/art/Magnum-Opus-Ex-3132-6-Zooms-274474754">This is his 2011 Deviant Art page for this location</a>.<br/><br/><a target="_blank" href="https://www.fractalforums.com/images-showcase-%28rate-my-fractal%29/reactor-core-ii-long-extended/msg91254/#msg91254">Here's a similar location posted to the forum</a> in 2016.  Also, check out <a target="_blank" href="https://www.deviantart.com/kosmic-stardust/gallery/9952329/fractals">all his fractals on Deviant Art</a>!  They're awesome.<br/><br/>This is my favorite Mandelbrot set location Iâ€™ve ever seen, and it was discovered around 2011 by stardust4ever (on fractalforums.com), after what sounds like a lot of searching.  This location is a large X shape, which is made of smaller X shapes, which are made of even smaller X shapes (stardust4ever fittingly called them chromosomes).<br/><br/>Using Very Plotter, the large render linked below took over 86 hours to render.  This location has a maximum iteration setting of 400,000 iterations, and nearly 360,000 iterations were skipped per pixel.  The 86 hour render was done with 8 JavaScript worker threads on my M1 Mac mini, at 10856x7760 pixels (>84 megapixels).  It was resized down to make a smooth and clean final result.
